location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 6: William Hornby, John Carnac, Daniel Draper, Henry Moore, Nathaniel Stackhouse, William Ashburner and Andrew Ramsay, Council at Bombay Castle, to [John Beaumont and George Green, Officials at Bushire]

mods.abstract: This letter, received 14 October 1778, has no stated recipient, but it would appear to be addressed to John Beaumont and George Green, East India Company officials at Bushire. The letter includes the following enclosures:Copies of extracts (listed as no. 7 and dated 4 July 1777) from the Company's commands, which discuss regulations concerning private business and financial regulations, a complaint made to the British Ambassador to the Port and the details of phirmands [firmans] issued;A copy of an extract (listed as no. 8 and dated 30 January 1778) from the Company's commands on bonds and financial regulations.
